Cheatsheet for Ruby Array Methods

Method Description Example Result
uniq Returns a new array by removing duplicate values in self [1,1,2,3,4,5,5,1,7].uniq [1,2,3,4,5,7]
pop Removes last element from array and returns it [1,2,3,4,5].pop 5
push Adds elements into the end of the array [1,2,3,4].push(5) [1,2,3,4,5]
reverse Reverse the array [1,2,3,4,5].reverse [5,4,3,2,1]
select Returns array where the block returns a true value [1,2,3,4,5].select {|num| num.even?} [2,4]
count, length Returns the number of elements [1,2,3,4,5].count OR [1,2,3,4,5].length 5
shuffle Returns array with elements of self shuffled randomly [1,2,3,4,5].shuffle [2,5,4,1,3]
include? Returns true if the given object is present in self (that is, if any element == object), otherwise returns false [1,2,3,4,5].include?(3) true
slice Returns an element at index or subarray starting from that index and continuing to a specified index [1,2,3,4,5].slice[1..3] [2,3,4]
sort Returns array created by sorting self [2,3,4,5,1,0].sort [0,1,2,3,4,5]
